Class AmazonWebServer

java.lang.Object
AmazonWebServer
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class AmazonWebServer
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
This class represents the Amazon Web Server node. It is responsible for reading in a .csv file containing a list of orders, and then distributing those orders to one of two Shipping Centers (based on which city the order is being shipped to). This class implements the Runnable interface, which declares one method, run().
Since:
10/11/2021
Author:
Tucker Dickson

  • Field Summary

    Fields 
    Modifier and Type Field Description
    private java.lang.String fileName
    This private String represents the name of the file containing the orders to be read in.
    private SynchronizedBuffer sc1SharedBuffer
    This private SynchronizedBuffer object will be used as the buffer linking the Web Server to Shipping Center 1.
    private SynchronizedBuffer sc2SharedBuffer
    This private SynchronizedBuffer object will be used as the buffer linking the Web Server to Shipping Center 2.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    AmazonWebServer​(SynchronizedBuffer sc1SharedBuffer, SynchronizedBuffer sc2SharedBuffer)
    This is the sole constructor for the AmazonWebServer class.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    void run()
    This method is declared in the Runnable interface.

    Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

    clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

  • Field Details

    • fileName

      private java.lang.String fileName
      This private String represents the name of the file containing the orders to be read in. The file name (and path) are hard-coded in the constructor.

    • sc1SharedBuffer

      private final SynchronizedBuffer sc1SharedBuffer
      This private SynchronizedBuffer object will be used as the buffer linking the Web Server to Shipping Center 1. All of the orders being shipped to LA, San Francisco, Seattle, and Denver will be put in this buffer, eventually to be picked up by Shipping Center 1.

    • sc2SharedBuffer

      private final SynchronizedBuffer sc2SharedBuffer
      This private SynchronizedBuffer object will be used as the buffer linking the Web Server to Shipping Center 2. All of the orders being shipped anywhere other than the cities listed above will be put in this buffer, eventually to be picked up by Shipping Center 2.

  • Constructor Details

    • AmazonWebServer

      public AmazonWebServer​(SynchronizedBuffer sc1SharedBuffer, SynchronizedBuffer sc2SharedBuffer)
      This is the sole constructor for the AmazonWebServer class. It takes in two arguments, each SynchronizedBuffer objects. It uses thse two objects to initialize sc1SharedBuffer and sc2SharedBuffer, respectively. It also sets fileName to the appropriate file path so that the orders file can be read in later.
      Parameters:
      sc1SharedBuffer - This SynchronizedBuffer object will be used to initialize sc1SharedBuffer.
      sc2SharedBuffer - This SynchronizedBuffer object will be used to initialize sc2SharedBuffer.

  • Method Details

    • run

      public void run()
      This method is declared in the Runnable interface. It gets called from main when the ExecutorService.execute() method is called and passed in an AmazonWebServer object. This method is responsible for reading in the orders from the orders file one-by-one, converting the order (a String) to an array, and then putting that array into the correct buffer, based on the city it's being shipped to.
      Specified by:
      run in interface java.lang.Runnable
